text: An AI system achieves superhuman performance on a comprehensive business management benchmark, successfully running a Fortune 500 company subsidiary for at least 6 months with minimal human oversight while maintaining or improving key performance metrics

A major AI company (OpenAI, Anthropic, Google DeepMind, or similar) reports achieving artificial general intelligence (AGI) or human-level AI across multiple cognitive domains, with independent verification from at least two research institutions

At least 3 countries implement universal basic income (UBI) programs explicitly citing AI-driven job displacement as the primary justification, with programs covering at least 10% of their adult population

AI development faces major technical scaling limitations, with leading AI companies publicly acknowledging that current transformer-based architectures have hit fundamental barriers and no clear path to AGI exists with current approaches
Global AI investment and compute spending growth rate falls below 20% annually for two consecutive years, indicating a cooling of AI development momentum and slower-than-expected progress
Global annual economic losses from extreme weather events exceed $500 billion in a single calendar year, as measured by insurance industry reports and international disaster databases

At least 10 million people are classified as climate migrants by UNHCR or IOM in a single calendar year, representing displacement primarily due to sea-level rise, desertification, or repeated extreme weather events
A major food-producing region (covering >1 million hectares) experiences complete crop failure for two consecutive years due to climate-related factors, affecting global food prices by >20%
Global carbon emissions peak and begin sustained decline of >5% year-over-year for at least two consecutive years, driven by rapid deployment of clean energy and carbon pricing policies

A climate-related infrastructure failure causes cascading disruptions lasting >30 days across multiple critical systems (power, water, transport, communications) in a major metropolitan area of >5 million people
The United States and China fail to renew or substantially modify major bilateral trade agreements, with tariffs on goods between the two countries exceeding 25% on average by end of 2025
At least 3 major powers (from US, China, Russia, India, EU) withdraw from or suspend participation in a major multilateral institution (UN Security Council, WTO, WHO, IMF) for more than 6 months
Two or more distinct economic blocs emerge with formal trade agreements covering at least 40% of global GDP each, with minimal trade integration between blocs (less than 20% of total trade)
A new multilateral climate agreement is successfully negotiated and ratified by countries representing at least 70% of global emissions, with binding enforcement mechanisms

Military spending by major powers (US, China, Russia, India, UK, France) increases by more than 50% in real terms compared to 2023 levels, with at least two powers deploying significant new military assets in contested regions
At least 5 major developing countries (with populations >50M) report total fertility rates dropping below 2.1 replacement level in official government statistics
China's working-age population (15-64) shrinks by more than 20 million people in a single year according to official census data
At least 3 developed nations implement major guest worker programs targeting workers aged 25-45, each admitting over 500,000 workers annually
Global average life expectancy increases by more than 3 years compared to 2023 levels, driven primarily by advances in aging-related healthcare
A major global economic crisis lasting over 18 months significantly disrupts migration patterns and causes fertility rates to rebound above replacement level in at least 10 countries
Major AI labs (OpenAI, Anthropic, Google DeepMind) publicly acknowledge hitting fundamental scaling limitations and pivot their research focus away from larger models
Global semiconductor industry fails to achieve meaningful progress beyond 3nm manufacturing node by 2028, with major fabs canceling or indefinitely postponing next-generation facilities
At least three major economies (US, EU, China) implement comprehensive AI development moratoria or severe restrictions that halt frontier model training for 12+ months
Breakthrough demonstration of room-temperature superconductor with practical applications verified by multiple independent labs
Global venture capital and corporate R&D investment in emerging technologies (AI, quantum, biotech, clean energy) declines by 40%+ from 2024 peak levels for two consecutive years

At least 3 major democracies (from G7 countries) implement significant constitutional reforms or new governance structures that incorporate digital participation mechanisms, such as mandatory citizen assemblies with binding authority or blockchain-based voting systems for key policy decisions
A political party or movement led primarily by individuals born after 1990 wins control of national government in at least 2 countries with populations over 20 million

At least 5 countries experience sustained anti-government protests lasting over 6 months that explicitly demand new forms of governance beyond traditional democracy, with protesters proposing specific alternative institutional frameworks

A major international organization (UN, EU, ASEAN, AU, or OAS) officially adopts and begins implementing a new governance model that significantly departs from traditional state-based representation, such as giving voting rights to cities, corporations, or algorithmically-determined constituencies

Democratic backsliding accelerates with Freedom House or similar democracy indices showing net negative scores for 4 consecutive years (2025-2028), while simultaneously no major new democratic innovations are successfully implemented at national scale
Major sovereign credit rating downgrades (below investment grade) for at least 3 G20 countries due to fiscal sustainability concerns
Global reinsurance market experiences capacity shortage with major reinsurers withdrawing from climate-exposed lines, causing primary insurance market disruptions in coastal regions
Corporate debt default rates in developed markets exceed 15% annually for investment-grade bonds, indicating widespread debt distress
Central bank coordination mechanism established (similar to 2008 swap lines) specifically for climate-related financial stability risks, with regular activation
Term structure inversion persists in major government bond markets (US, Germany, Japan) for over 18 consecutive months while inflation remains above 4%
A major laboratory breach or containment failure occurs at a BSL-3 or BSL-4 facility handling dangerous pathogens, with confirmed pathogen release requiring emergency response and quarantine measures

A novel respiratory pathogen emerges with pandemic potential (WHO declares PHEIC) that demonstrates both high transmissibility (R0 > 2.5) and significant mortality rate (CFR > 3%) in initial outbreaks

Multiple countries report widespread community transmission of extensively drug-resistant (XDR) or totally drug-resistant (TDR) bacterial infections that resist all available antibiotics, with case fatality rates exceeding 50%

Climate change-related thawing of permafrost or melting ice releases viable ancient pathogens, with confirmed cases of human infection from these released microorganisms documented by peer-reviewed research

A comprehensive global pandemic preparedness treaty is signed by all G20 nations, establishing mandatory pathogen surveillance systems, rapid response protocols, and coordinated international stockpiles of medical countermeasures

The UN Security Council successfully mediates and resolves at least 3 major international disputes (involving state-level conflicts or territorial tensions) through diplomatic mechanisms without military escalation by end of 2027
Global inflation rates stabilize between 2-4% across G20 economies for 12 consecutive months, with no major financial system collapses or banking crises

The Paris Climate Agreement framework remains intact with at least 180 countries maintaining their commitments, and global emissions show either stabilization or decline of up to 3% annually (avoiding both rapid acceleration and dramatic crash)

A major nuclear power (US, Russia, China, UK, France, India, Pakistan, Israel, or North Korea) experiences severe internal political instability leading to regime change, military coup, or civil conflict lasting more than 6 months
The global food system experiences a major supply shock affecting at least 20% of world grain production for more than one growing season, due to climate events, conflict, or other disruption

A major climate disaster (category 5 hurricane, unprecedented wildfire, or extreme flooding) causes economic damages exceeding $200 billion in a single event, leading to sovereign debt crisis or banking sector collapse in the affected region
Two or more G20 countries simultaneously experience government collapse, military coups, or sustained civil unrest lasting over 6 months, with these events occurring within 12 months of each other

A coordinated international response successfully manages a multi-crisis scenario (e.g., pandemic + climate disaster + economic shock) through new multilateral institutions or mechanisms, demonstrating enhanced global resilience

Global food prices increase by over 100% from 2023 baseline levels for a sustained period (6+ months), triggered by simultaneous crop failures across multiple major agricultural regions due to extreme weather
Complete breakdown of a major international institution (UN Security Council ceases functioning, NATO dissolves, or EU fragments with 3+ major countries leaving) due to cascading geopolitical crises
